column4: Syria destroyed equipment for making chemical weapons
Syria destroyed all the declared facilities for production of chemical weapons, as recognized by the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons.
Damascus finished the first stage of the disarmament the day before the deadline.
By 1 November Syria was to destroy the manufacturing and other auxiliary objects intended for combat training in the use of toxic substances, reports the BBC.
The destruction of the stockpile of toxic substances or their chemical components should be completed by the middle of 2014.
According to the representative of the OPCW, currently toxic substances are in Opechatannykh repositories.
International inspectors went to Syria after, according to the United States, more than 1,400 people were killed by on 21 August by chemical attacks on the outskirts of Damascus.
The main task of the inspectors was to not give Syrian authorities time to produce more chemical weapons and to destroy infrastructure equipment for mixing chemicals and munitions.
Inspectors will now be carefully watching these manufacturing facilities to prevent their repair.
The next milestone is the middle of November: by this time the OPCW and Syria must agree to a detailed plan of destruction of existing stocks of toxic substances.
A lot of questions here.
Where will they be removed?
Who will provide the equipment for this?
All Syrian statements will be carefully checked by western razvedsluzhbami.
The inspectors are ready to test new substances to see if there are grounds to suspect that Damascus is not being fully candid.
The United States believed that the shelling was being done by regular troops.
Syria and Russia insist that this was the work of the Syrian rebels.

The world community has demanded from the Syrian leadership that it is in accordance with the agreement reached and mediated by Russia which is to destroy or make inoperable all capacity for the production of shells, toxic gases and liquids and shells for filling in these substances.
Now, when this phase is complete, the next step must be to destroy the existing the Syrian army chemical weapons.

It is assumed that this arsenal could be more than 1,000 tons of toxic substances including kozhno-naryvnogo, nerve gas, mustard gas and other banned chemicals stored in several dozen different places.
The agreed upon time table between the OPCW and the Syrian authorities for its destruction is two weeks.
The head of the OPCW field operations, Jerry Smith, told the BBC that his inspectors "personally watched the destruction of the equipment
And they now have no capability to conduct further production or mixing of chemical weapons, he said.

In the statement, the OPCW said its inspectors visited 21 of the 23 sites in Syria and were convinced the factories that manufacture shells and toxic substances, were either destroyed or are being destroyed.
The remaining two objects were too dangerous to carry out an inspection, the document says, but the equipment was carried out and inspected by specialists of the OPCW.
According to Smith, the process of destroying the production infrastructure was especially difficult due to the ongoing conflict.
In early October, the OPCW was awarded the Nobel peace prize, however; according to Smith, the inspectors have not had time to celebrate yet - they were too busy with work.
John kerry says in his unprecedented recognition that USA espionage "went far nepodobayushche"
John kerry demonstrated easing tactics to protect U.S. tracking programs, making an unprecedented acknowledgment that in some cases, us spying "went far nepodobayushche."

The secretary also acknowledged that the guilty, along with Barack Obama, has been "on autopilot" during the appearance of the high-profile revelations by Edward Snowden about the espionage activities of the NSA.
These leaks have put the US government at the center of a diplomatic scandal with its allies.

Then he became the first senior member of the government of the United States to recognize that the US espionage has gone too far, but stressed that individual rights were not violated.
He said: "in some cases this has come far nepodobayushche.
And the president is determined to shed light on this question and explain to people, and now conducts a thorough analysis to ensure that no one has the feeling of abuse.

In the world there are radical extremism, bezrassudnyy and determined to kill people, blowing up people and attacking the government.
And if you were able to intercept it, stop it before it happens?

The senator from Connecticut, Chris Murphy said he talked with members of the European parliament, and the other parties on this week and is concerned about their threats to suspend participation in the anti-terrorist organizations because of disappointment in connection with the persecution of the national security agency.

For us national security interests are really important to europeans remained our supporters in respect of our joint counter-terrorism efforts, said democrat Murphy, working in the position of first term and is the chairman of the international relations of the senate subcommittee on european affairs, in an interview from Washington.
And i am going to europe, to get them to understand that we must continue to cooperate in the fight against terrorism, despite their anger over these nsa programs.

News that the NSA collected millions of records of telephone calls in europe worsen relations with some allies of the us, although the head of the agency said this week that they were inaccurate and reflected a misunderstanding that collected metadata on NATO allies and which they shared with the united states.

In other quoted Snowden razoblacheniyakh released documents showing that the NSA continued monitoring the mobile phone of german chancellor Angela Merkel, as well as phones of approximately 34 other world leaders.
Director of national intelligence James Klapper defended espionage activities in respect of allies as necessary and said that it is commonplace on both sides.

Against the backdrop of this hype Murphy said his office organizes a trip for members of congress, which is expected to take place this year, and that he hoped that the delegation will include members of both parties and both houses.
The names of the other participating legislators should be voiced in the coming days.
According to him, the programs of the trip are still at the development stage.
Although Murphy has said that the goal of the trip is to improve relations, he said that "a degree of well-meaning rigidity" will emerge.
He said that european leaders must be honest with his people in what spyware programs they have used for many years.

While we can change our tracking program to better protect the rights of europeans, they must also agree with the fact that we are not the only people involved in intelligence activities, Murphy said.

Meanwhile, mr Kerry will head into this weekend in the middle east and in Poland for solving the problems of hostility against the U.S. strategy in Syria, Egypt and Iran, but also the United States intelligence activity.
